channel.title: Dominic's blog on Dominic Minischetti
channel.description: Recent content in Dominic's blog on Dominic Minischetti

item.title: The Internet Was Once a Place
item.description: There was a time when the internet felt like a place. With doors. With people. With warmth. A personal reflection on what we lost, and what we can still rebuild.

item.title: Your Phone Isn’t Spying — But the Truth Is Worse
item.description: Think your phone is listening? Think again. Learn how data tracking, predictive algorithms, and behavioral profiling truly work — and why it's way creepier than spying.

item.title: Best Minimalist Desk Setup for Productivity in 2025 (Remote Work Edition)
item.description: Build a distraction-free, minimalist workspace that boosts your productivity in 2025. A witty, smart guide for remote workers, developers, and deep work fanatics.

item.title: How a CMS Can Make or Break Digital Publishing (And Why I’m All In with BLOX)
item.description: A look at why a great CMS is essential for digital publishing, how BLOX Digital is leading the way, and why I'm excited about BLOX NXT.

item.title: Why You Should Save Images as PNG Instead of JPG (Most of the Time!)
item.description: A breakdown of why PNG is often the better choice over JPG—because nobody wants their images looking like they were printed on a potato.

item.title: Logging Out for Good: Why I’m Leaving Facebook and Instagram
item.description: Social media was supposed to keep me connected with friends. Instead, it's just ads, strangers, and reminders of things I can't have anymore.

item.title: Love Notes (and Bugs) in the Silence of Home
item.description: A love story told in the quiet moments of working from home together.

item.title: Notion: The External Brain That Finally Works for Me
item.description: Struggling to keep track of your ideas and tasks? Discover why Notion is the external brain I never knew I needed.

item.title: The 7 Stages of a Developer Fixing a Bug
item.description: Fixing a bug isn’t just about code—it’s an emotional rollercoaster. Discover the 7 stages every developer goes through while debugging.

item.title: The Multitasking Myth: Why Doing Less Makes You More Productive
item.description: Multitasking is a lie. Discover why single-tasking is the real productivity superpower and how it’s transforming my focus and life.

item.title: How Every Developer Writes Code (Whether They Admit It or Not)
item.description: Coding isn’t as glamorous as it seems. Discover the hilariously relatable stages every developer goes through while writing code.

item.title: The Productivity Trap: Why Doing More Is Keeping You Stuck
item.description: Productivity isn’t about doing more—it’s about doing what matters. Discover how to escape the productivity trap and find real progress.

item.title: Why I, a Programmer, Still Use Paper Like It’s 1999
item.description: Digital tools are powerful, but when it comes to problem-solving, nothing beats paper. Here’s why I, a programmer, still use analog methods.

item.title: The Never-Ending Search for the Perfect App: Why I Can’t Stop Downloading
item.description: Obsessed with finding the perfect app? You’re not alone. Join me on my endless quest for the ultimate productivity tools.

item.title: The Pursuit of the Perfect: My Quest for the Ultimate Everything
item.description: Minimalism taken to the next level—finding the one perfect item for everything. Discover my quest for ultimate efficiency and portability.

item.title: How I Outsmart My Own Brain to Get Things Done
item.description: Life feels like an action movie with no pause button. Here's how I handle the chaos and still get things done.

item.title: The Browser Wars: My Exhausting Journey to Finding the Least Annoying Setup
item.description: Choosing a browser shouldn't be this hard. From Safari’s WebKit prison to Windows’ Chromium clones, here’s my exhausting browser journey.

item.title: The Motivation Myth: Why Waiting to Feel Inspired Will Keep You Stuck
item.description: Motivation is a lie. Discover why waiting to feel inspired keeps you stuck and learn practical strategies to take action anyway.

item.title: Why Changing Your Mind is a Sign of Intelligence, Not Weakness
item.description: Changing your mind isn’t a weakness—it’s growth. Discover why evolving your perspective makes you smarter and more adaptable.

item.title: The Best Everyday Backpack? My Never-Ending Search for the Perfect One
item.description: The quest for the perfect backpack feels like an endless life mission. From too many pockets to uncomfortable straps, the search continues.
